item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:11, topic:298472”][quote author=cane link=topic=394871.msg2934804#msg2934804 date=1251494204]

This is a baddddd guide to be honest, even though it’s good. You should explain to be prepared before using css rather then going along while thinking at the same time about what style you will use for your website’s coating(the colors -> skinning), it just slow down the development of the site in elapsed time. I read blogs a lot and have come across a tip that the best website structure practice is to always finishing the html first before css, but the design should be FIRST if html isn’t applied yet, otherwise the html. So use good spatial order ;D.

Im going over the color scheme in the next tutorial and why would you do the html first if it has no style, you will not know how it will look. I think you should always create the style then add it.
[/quote]

But you dont even know what selector you will use to apply style to your html… Its just like making a blueprint first and then building it. Get it?[/quote]
Does it really matter which way around you do it? nope.

item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Ok so first tutorial in web design so if you notice any mistakes let me know and i will correct them. Im not going to explain everything i do yet as im getting pissed and cbf. There will be no images in this tutorial as its just for the layout In the next tutorial I will add images and improve on various things.

Before we start you are going to need the following:

A file named ‘index.html’
And a file name ‘style.css’
Any editor (im using notepad ++)
[sup]Those are what im using in this tutorial you can change if you wish but you will need to make modifications in my tutorial to suit your needs.[/sup]

To start you will need to open up your index.html file and fill it out with the following:

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title>Home</title>
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
</head>
<body>



</body>
</html>

[sup]Editing the current layout.
If you have renamed the style.css you will need to edit it here, to edit the title for the homepage just edit between ’ '[/sup]
It should look something like this

2w6thf9.jpg699×244

Creating a layout
[i]Now it is time to create some kind of layout. I will be using 800px (width) by 700px (height).

What we do now is open up ‘style.css’ and create 2 new ID’s, so we put into the ‘style.css’ file the following
[/i]

body {

[sup]this lets us style the body tags[/sup]

text-align: center; }
[sup]im not 100% on this but im pretty sure this is how we center our web page in IE[/sup]

.wrapper {

[sup]This is the name of the ID we are creating[/sup]

	margin-left: auto;
	margin-right: auto;
	width: 800px;
	text-align: left;
}

[sup]im not 100% sure on this bit either but i think it centers our web page in all other browsers you can edit the width in this to what ever you want.[/sup]

Ok so your ‘style.css’ should look like this

body {
	text-align: center;
}
#wrapper {
	margin-left: auto;
	margin-right: auto;
	width: 800px;
	text-align: left;
}

Now open up ‘index.html’ and add this between the tags

[code]

[/code] [sup]This will center anything that is entered in between the wrapper divs.[/sup]

Now our web page will be in the center of the page you need to add a layout.

First i will start on our banner (im not using images in our banner to save time creating it)
Open up ‘style.css’ and add the following

#banner {
	width: 800px;
	height: 70px;
	text-align: center;
	float: left;
	background-color: #ccc;
}

[sup]as you can see the width is 800px, the height is 70px, the text will be in the center and the background color will be gray (we will improve on these later on the next tutorial)[/sup]

Now the style of the banner has been done we need to add it to our main page to open up ‘index.html’ and under the tags add this

<div id="banner">Site Name</div>

[sup]This adds it to our main page. What you can change in here is what is between the divs (site name)[/sup]

Your index page should now look like this

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title>home</title>
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
</head>
<body>
<div id="wrapper">
<div id="banner">Site Name</div>


</div>
</body>
</html>

j67sxh.jpg840×330

Now you have your banner done its time to add some more sections. First i will add a navigation section so open up your style.css and add the following at the bottom.

#navigation {
	width: 800px;
	height: 25px;
	text-align: left;
	float: left;
	background-color: purple;
}

[sup]I have made the text align to the left because that’s how i prefer it, and i have given it purple for the background so you can identify it on your page (in the next tutorial it will be made into more of a navigation bar)[/sup]

Now you need to add it into your index page so under the tags add

<div id="navigation">Test  |  LOl  |  shit</div>

Your page should now look like this

309ketf.jpg809×344

So now the navigation is done im going to add 2 more sections so open up style and add the following

#news {
	margin-top: 3px;
	width: 200px;
	height: 599px;
	background-color: green;
	float: left;
	margin-right: 3px;
}
#content {
	margin-top: 3px;
	width: 597px;
	height: 599px;
	background-color: blue;
	float: left;
	}

[sup]From this we have created 2 new sections called news and a content section, from looking at what I have wrote there will be a space from the top of 3px for both sections and will have 3px space between each other. The news section’s background will be green and the content area will be blue. [/sup]

Now the styles for those are done you need to add them to the index page. So open up ‘index.html’ and under the divs add the following

<div id="news">Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old.</div>
<div id="content">Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.</div>

10d8b3d.jpg903×397

It should now look like this

deme7p.jpg889×706

Ok so now you have 4 sections: A banner, Navigation, A News box and a Content area. This should not be the end of this tutorial but it is because tea is ready and im hungry.

Your full html document should look like this

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html>
<head>
<title>home</title>
<link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
</head>
<body>
<div id="wrapper">
<div id="banner">Site Name</div>
<div id="navigation">Test  |  LOl  |  shit</div>
<div id="news">Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old.</div>
<div id="content">Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.</div>

</div>
</body>
</html>

o5asdx.jpg912×342

And your Style.css document should look like this

body {
	text-align: center;
}
#wrapper {
	margin-left: auto;
	margin-right: auto;
	width: 800px;
	text-align: left;
}
#banner {
	width: 800px;
	height: 70px;
	text-align: center;
	float: left;
	background-color: #ccc;
}
#navigation {
	width: 800px;
	height: 25px;
	text-align: left;
	float: left;
	background-color: purple;
}
#news {
	margin-top: 3px;
	width: 200px;
	height: 599px;
	background-color: green;
	float: left;
	margin-right: 3px;
}
#content {
	margin-top: 3px;
	width: 597px;
	height: 599px;
	background-color: blue;
	float: left;
	}

2lsuy46.jpg388×645

What is in the next tutorial?

[ul][li]Improving the color scheme[/li]
[li]adding a background and images[/li]
[li]padding[/li]
[li]Maybe creating the navigation or i might make another tutorial to build on that[/li][/ul]
